Title: How Did Babies per Woman Change in Different Regions? Short answer — It dropped everywhere

content.paragraph: The number of babies born per woman has dropped across the world. Back in the year 1950, it was about 4.5 babies per woman in all regions on average.
content.table:
Entity	Year	Fertility rate - Sex: all - Age: all - Variant: estimates
Africa (UN)	1950	6.5856
Asia (UN)	1950	5.7054
Europe (UN)	1950	2.6966
Latin America and the Caribbean (UN)	1950	5.7971
Northern America (UN)	1950	2.9742
Oceania (UN)	1950	3.672

annotation.text: The number of babies born per woman has dropped across the world. Back in the year 1950, it was about 4.5 babies per woman in all regions on average.
